captions.text: At BMW there is a strong belief

that the best way
to predict the future is to create it.

Think of some of the most powerful letter
in the world.
BMW M set the standards for dynamic driving.
BMW i is not only beautiful,
it also stands for sustainability.

And now, with this car,
BMW creates the future of luxury.

Here it is,
the all-new BMW 7 Series.

I can't show you the design right now,
but I can show you some features.
Some of which you've never seen before.
Like this feature, for instance.
The new remote control parking function.

Pull in and out...
The car does it all for you.
No need to sit inside anymore.
To activate it, all you need is the key.
Well, forget everything you know about keys.

As a driver of the all-new BMW 7 Series,
you'll get a BMW display key.

Now this is a remote control
and LCD control screen in one.

It operates various functions
and supplies you with useful information.
This is just one example of many

for the new way of interaction
between driver and car.

And BMW will be first in class
to offer gesture command

as well as a navigation
with a touch screen for improved operating.
Also an all-new level of voice command.

BMW was the first car manufacturer
to use carbon fiber in production cars,

and is using
this intelligent lightweight material
in all-new BMW 7 Series vehicles.

We're at the BMW Plant Dingolfing
in Germany, near Munich.

Maybe you can tell us a bit more
about carbon fiber used in the BMW 7 Series.

{\an1}BMW is an innovation leader
when it comes to carbon in the auto industry.

We've now transferred the technology
from BMW i to the BMW core brand.

Carbon is a very innovative material.
It's light and it's rigid.

We strengthen the body,
for example the roof reinforcement.
And it's a part of our construction strategy.

Firstly,
it feels "BMW-like" when you drive it.
It doesn't feel like a big car.

On top of that, it lowers the weight
of the car and increases efficiency.
Carbon fiber is light, yet rigid.

It saves up to 50% of weight
over conventional materials,
while it also improves rigidity.

As we heard, the use of carbon fiber
goes hand in hand with driving dynamics.

And the BMW 7 Series has always been
the most dynamic car in its segment.

With the new generation model, the sense
of comfort and well-being excels equally.

The all-new BMW 7 Series combines comfort
and driving dynamics in a special way,

and is everything you expect,
setting exceptional standards.

You just hang in there,
the wait is almost over.

And be sure to tune back in again
for the next update
on the all-new BMW 7 Series.

comments.text:
For my liking, the design (You know where to see it.) is ugly. Mercedes S 
Class is a lot more classy, avantgarde, handsome, dominant, luxurious 
looking while keeping it dynamic and yet "formal" looking (Which is, in my 
opinion, so important for the people the segment appeals to).

I like BMW, I really do. (Looking to buy myself 4 series while having a dad 
refuses to drive anything besides Merc). Brand stands for agility, 
dynamics, sporty ride however for the last 3-4 years, I think, in terms of 
design, it has started to lose against Mercedes.﻿

comments.author: Andre Coutinho

comments.text:
Don`t get me wrong, I`m a BMW fan, had a few and still own some models but 
touchscreen...the future... yeeeeeeahright. My 1st TomTom had a touchscreen 
in 2005 when there was no screen at all in any car, except the really 
expensive ones. So this is not really future, but realising that it was 
maybe about time to implement a touchscreen already. Cheaper car makers had 
it earlier than BMW, aftermarket radios even earlier. And i bet they`ll use 
the cheap pressure screen any chinese portable GPS has instead of the more 
expensive touch-responsive screen :D that`ll probably be a future "feature" 
or something. 

And voice commands... well, I had it and it is extremely fun to use while 
it is new. After some time you just don`t bother anymore because you want 
to just drive, listen to music or just the engine and not think about 
anything else. But it is definetly a cool "dude look what my car does" 
thing :) and a side note - if one wants to present himself as the maker of 
future (* a reference to the statement of to know the future you have to 
create it) it may be a good idea to check if all the things that count as 
"it" weren`t done before by someone else :) like the W212 MB which has 
voice command since, dunno, 2009? 2010?

But whatever, I like to fool around a little and I`m looking forward to see 
the final car even thou I like the old ones better and do not plan to buy 
it :)﻿

Germans never used to put touch screens in their cars, they never even used 
to put cupholders in their cars which Americans viewed as a horror. Now 
Germans put cupholders in their cars but up until 2014-2015 they have never 
put NAV with touch screen before, but now I think more people will be 
willing to buy them if they did. I think it is an amazing car, the 7 Series 
is one of the biggest luxury cars along with the A8 and the S Class. Great 
Job BMW, let's see if you can go chase down the S Class! Well Done!﻿
